author: world today news
title: Bulgaria’s Acceptance into the Schengen Agreement: A Historic Step Forward
text:
“I want to clearly say to all colleagues and analysts, as well as to our friends and like-minded people: There is no way that success can be presented as failure. Despite many efforts in this direction. Air Schengen is not “nothing”, the co-chairman of PP Kiril Petkov.
“I understand that our political and geopolitical opponents are not particularly happy about the
news of Bulgaria’s acceptance into the Schengen Agreement.
However, there are times when political and party interests must give way to national interests. And today is just such a day.
– Bulgaria has been waiting for this moment for 12 years.
– Air Schengen is “nothing” – ask the tens of thousands of Bulgarians who fill airports and airline planes, work in Europe, go home to their relatives for the holidays.
– We will receive significant financial resources to strengthen the borders.
– This decision will be an incentive for the Bulgarian border
police to work even better, it will be a blow to human traffickers.
– There will be an increased presence of “Frontex” forces in guarding the border – this is solidarity and exchange of experience, and is an additional security guarantee.
– We’re in the game. Bulgaria politically becomes a Schengen member, participates in all formats and negotiations, has the right of veto.
– Our acceptance into Schengen for the air and sea borders was a matter of regained trust, a matter of security and a matter of European integration. Europe gives us what we deserve for all three.
Read more: Joo Ho-young suggests veto power as the sole means to thwart the Grain Management Act and labels the Democratic Party's behavior as shameful.
– We are still obliged to register and accept migrants – this is according to the Dublin Agreement – it is nothing new.
–
Russia, whose policy is to encourage migrants from the Middle East to Europe by any means, is now deploying all its media and institutional resources to portray Bulgaria’s success as a failure. For example, look at what is happening with Finland right now – they are closing their borders because Russia is bussing large groups of refugees. A few months ago, the same thing happened on the Polish-Belarusian border.
I congratulate Nikolay Denkov and the entire government for the huge step forward,” Petkov also wrote.
2023-12-30 19:43:00
#Kiril #Petkov #Air #Schengen #success #presented #failure

author: 小浪财讯
title: 通威股份股价连续3天下跌累计跌幅6.32%，博时基金旗下2只基金合计持38.71万股，浮亏损失51.1万元_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
8月14日， 通威股份 跌3.07%，截至发稿，报19.56元/股，成交16.44亿元，换手率1.85%，总市值880.59亿元。通威股份股价已经连续3天下跌，区间累计跌幅6.32%。
资料显示，通威股份有限公司位于中国(四川)自由贸易试验区成都市高新区天府大道中段588号，成立日期1995年12月8日，上市日期2004年3月2日，公司主营业务涉及水产饲料、畜禽饲料等产品的研究、生产和销售;高纯晶硅、 太阳能 电池等产品的研发、生产、销售为主。主营业务收入构成为：太阳能电池、组件及相关业务45.03%，饲料、食品及相关业务34.50%，高纯晶硅、化工及相关业务21.63%，光伏电力及相关业务2.22%，其他(补充)0.50%。
从基金十大重仓股角度
数据显示，博时基金旗下2只基金重仓通威股份股票，合计持有通威股份38.71万股，按前一日收盘20.18元，今日截止发稿股价19.56元计算，日浮亏24万元。连续3天下跌期间浮亏损失51.1万元。
基金名称 基金代码 基金经理 持股数量(股) 占流通股比例(%) 占基金净值比(%) 持股数量变动(股) 博时中证光伏产业指数A 015993 王祥 249400 0.0055 5.02 +30400 博时新能源ETF 516580 尹浩 137700 0.003 2.55 -9900
其中，博时中证光伏产业指数A（015993）二季度增持3.04万股，持有股数24.94万股，占基金净值比例为5.02%，位居第五大重仓股。根据测算，今日浮亏损失约15.46万元。连续3天下跌期间浮亏损失32.92万元。
博时新能源ETF（516580）二季度减持9900股，持有股数13.77万股，占基金净值比例为2.55%，位居第九大重仓股。根据测算，今日浮亏损失约8.54万元。连续3天下跌期间浮亏损失18.18万元。

author: Keagan Stiefel
title: Patriots Rumors: QB Plan 'News' To 'High-Ranking' Executives
text: The Patriots reportedly are “zeroing in” on a three-step plan to completely reshape their quarterback room, but according to a conflicting report, they haven’t made that plan known to “high-ranking personnel evaluators” in their own front office. It looks like we’ve got a good old-fashioned source-off! Andrew Callahan and Doug Kyed of the Boston Herald published a report Thursday that threw some cold water on a previously reported story by Mark Daniels, Karen Guregian and Chris Mason of MassLive. The MassLive story essentially laid out a plan the Patriots reportedly intend on executing this offseason. It would see them select a quarterback with the No. 3 pick in the 2024 NFL Draft, sign a veteran free agent and ship Mac Jones off to pastures anew. The Boston Herald story, which was posted a number of hours later , claims “such a decision has not been communicated throughout the Patriots’ front office.” Story continues below advertisement More Patriots Patriots director of scouting Eliot Wolf recently led pre-combine meetings where scouts deliberated drafting a quarterback at No. 3, according to Kyed and Callahan’s sources. That means New England has not yet made a decision. There’s an easy explanation for all of this, and that’s the fact that some sources might not be as well informed as others. If the Patriots did have a plan in place, not everyone in the building would be privy to it. New England also has two months to change things up, so at this point, it’s all conjecture anyway. [Leave a comment.](javascript:void(0)) It’s interesting to think about how the inner workings of New England’s front office have changed in recent months, however. Bill Belichick rarely let his plans leak, though he never had this big of a decision looming at the start of an offseason. Jerod Mayo has been telling us it’s a new era in New England , and that’s becoming more clear with each day report. Story continues below advertisement Featured image via Kirby Lee/USA TODAY Sports Images

author: @KSLA
title: Hot sunshine for Friday & the weekend
text:
SHREVEPORT, La. (KSLA) -
Hot sunshine for Friday & the weekend
Mostly sunny skies will be with the ArkLaTex throughout Friday. There is a slim 10% chance of rain for SE OK & NE TX today while the rest of the region stays completely dry. High temperatures get up to the upper 80′s and lower 90′s.
The weekend provides plenty of sunshine ahead for both days with not a drop of rain in sight. High temperatures ramp up each day with high’s on Saturday reaching the lower 90′s and high’s on Sunday reaching the mid 80′s.
Sunshine rolls on all of next work week as we look to continue our dry stretch of weather. The next chance of rain might come the following weekend, but we’ll see. High temperatures drop a lot next week. High’s slightly cool into the mid to upper 80′s for Monday before falling into the mid to upper 70′s for Tuesday. High’s then look to stay around that mark for the rest of the work week with low temperatures dipping into the 40′s by Wednesday morning.
Have a fantastic Friday & a great sunny weekend!
- Meteorologist Evan Thomason

author: Cecilia Seiter
title: It's goodbye to Tuk Tuk Thai; Hapuku Fish Shop leaves Market Hall
text:
Editor’s note: Nosh covers food and restaurant news across the East Bay, and each week we publish one article covering all the restaurant openings and one article covering closings. Have a tip for Nosh? Submit it here.
Ali Baba
Ali Baba, a Middle Eastern café coveted for its breakfast burritos, wordlessly closed its Berkeley location, a reader reports. For those willing to make the trek, its original Davis location is still open. Ali Baba was located at 1805 Euclid Ave.
Fuji Summer
A reader let us know that Fuji Summer, a modern Japanese restaurant on Oakland’s Piedmont Ave., has apparently shuttered. The restaurant wasn’t reachable by phone, and the “closed” sign has reportedly been up for several weeks. Fuji Summer was located at 3858 Piedmont Ave.
Hapuku Fish Shop
After 20 years of pouring heart and sole into Rockridge’s Market Hall, Hapuku Fish Shop closed for good on Jan. 26. While loyal patrons are sad to see Hapuku (and their fish and chips) go, they’ll still find fresh seafood at Market Hall: Billingsgate Seafood is slated to open in Hapuku’s place in the coming days. We’ll keep you posted. Hapuku was located at 5655 College Ave. in Oakland.
Tuk Tuk Thai Café
Thanks to several tipsters, we learned that the family-run establishment Tuk Tuk Thai Café has closed for good after serving the Berkeley community for 24 years. The closure was confirmed on Tuk Tuk’s website. Tuk Tuk Thai Café was located at 2468 Shattuck Ave. in Berkeley.
